title: India-US trade deal: Trump says 'another deal coming up, maybe with India'
content: US President Donald Trump announced the possibility of a new trade deal with India, coinciding with ongoing trade talks between Indian commerce officials and the US in Washington DC. The US administration is reportedly considering offering India a tariff rate below 20%, seeking market access in India, similar to the recent agreement with Indonesia.

title: 'You have scope to come to our side': Fadnavis's swipe at Uddhav or message to Shinde?
content: Devendra Fadnavis  "invitation" swipe at Uddhav Thackeray has reignited speculation about potential realignments within Maharashtra's political landscape. This comes amid reports of unease between Fadnavis and Eknath Shinde, particularly concerning the upcoming BMC elections and the conduct of Shinde Sena MLAs.

title: Massive prediction! KL Rahul tipped to eclipse Shubman Gill soon
content: Former England cricketer Owais Shah predicts KL Rahul will thrive in Test cricket, stepping out of Virat Kohli's shadow. Shah highlights Rahul's technique and mental strength, anticipating he'll become India's primary batting pillar, potentially outscoring Shubman Gill over time. Rahul's recent century at Lord's, a historic feat, underscores his potential.

title: Goldman Sachs hires a new employee that could be a 'nightmare' for engineering graduates
content: Goldman Sachs is set to revolutionize its software development by integrating Devin, an AI software engineer, aiming to enhance productivity and automate routine tasks. This move signals a significant shift in the financial industry's labor dynamics, potentially impacting entry-level positions as AI coders become integral to the workforce.

title: 'Not picking Kuldeep Yadav has hurt India; you can't expect him to score 100 runs'
content: Kuldeep Yadav's prolonged absence from the ongoing Test series in England has sparked debate, with his coach Kapil Dev Pandey advocating for his inclusion in the fourth Test at Old Trafford. Pandey emphasizes Kuldeep's current form and potential impact, especially given Manchester's spin-friendly conditions.

title: TCS gives 100% variable pay to 70% employees; Payment to rest of employees will be based on ...
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) will provide 100% variable pay to approximately 70% of its employees up to the C2 grade for the June quarter. Variable pay for employees in the C3 grade and above will be determined by the performance of their respective business units.

title: Shocking! Ravi Shastri blames Karun Nair's 'huge lapse in concentration' for Lord's defeat
content: Ravi Shastri analyzed India's loss to England at Lord's. He highlighted Rishabh Pant's crucial dismissal before lunch. Karun Nair's wicket early in the second innings triggered a collapse. Shastri praised the lower order's fight but noted the top order's struggles. He drew parallels with India's 2021 Lord's win. Shastri remains optimistic about India's comeback in the series.

title: Anand Mahindra's message to Elon Musk on Tesla India launch: Meet you at ...
content: Anand Mahindra welcomed Elon Musk and Tesla to India as the EV company officially debuted with its first showroom, the Tesla Experience Centre, in Mumbai. Mahindra expressed optimism and acknowledged the competition Tesla brings to India's growing EV sector. Tesla has launched its Model Y in India, with prices starting at Rs 61 lakh.

title: Israel strikes Syria’s military, defence ministry HQ; blast near presidential palace
content: Israel launched a direct strike on the Syrian military headquarters in Damascus following escalating violence against Druze civilians in southern Syria. The IDF confirmed the strike, targeting military infrastructure near the Defense Ministry, as part of a broader campaign to deter threats near Israel's northern border.

title: India-US trade deal: India wants Trump to offer tariff rate lower than Indonesia
content: India-US trade deal:  American President Trump aims for US market access into India, similar to the Indonesia trade deal. However, India seeks even lower tariffs, below Indonesia's 19%. Negotiations are underway, targeting rates under 20%, potentially even below 10%.

title: Conor McGregor breaks silence: Cryptic tweet after Azealia Banks leak
content: Azealia Banks ignited a social media storm by claiming Conor McGregor, celebrating his birthday in Italy, sent her nude photos. Instead of directly addressing the allegations, McGregor responded to a fan's joke with a political comment about Irish politics. Banks further alleged a long history of nude exchanges and harassment, while McGregor continued posting from his yacht, seemingly unfazed.

title: Dwyane Wade on Norman Powell — calls Miami Heat trade a dream
content: Dwayne Wade expressed his excitement about Norman Powell joining the Miami Heat, highlighting Powell's admiration for him and his game. Wade believes Powell's competitive spirit and All-Star caliber will greatly benefit the team. Powell himself described the trade as a dream come true, having grown up idolizing Wade and the Heat organization.

title: 'Can come to the ruling side': CM Fadnavis' offer for former ally Uddhav
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis hinted at a possible BJP-Shiv Sena (UBT) coalition, suggesting Uddhav Thackeray could join the ruling side. This remark comes amid Uddhav's criticism of the BJP and speculation about a reunion of the Thackeray cousins. MNS chief Raj Thackeray refuted claims of alliance talks with Uddhav, accusing journalists of misrepresenting his comments.

title: Indian man arrested in US for child porn; Cong, BJP link accused with AAP
content: Gurjeet Singh Malhi, an Indian man, was arrested in Washington by ICE on charges related to child sexual abuse material. The arrest has ignited a political firestorm in Punjab, with photographs circulating showing Malhi alongside leaders from AAP, Congress, SAD and BJP. Opposition parties are demanding clarification from AAP regarding Malhi's connections to party members.

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce unite — support Scott Swift’s recovery
content: Taylor Swift prioritized her family as her father, Scott Swift, underwent a quintuple bypass surgery last month. She paused her Eras Tour obligations to be with him, along with her mother, Andrea, and brother, Austin. Travis Kelce, her boyfriend, offered his support during this challenging time, as the family focused on Scott's recovery following the procedure.

title: Kyle Schwarber makes history: first Phillies All-Star MVP since 1964
content: Kyle Schwarber delivered a historic performance at the 2025 MLB All-Star Game, securing the MVP award with a clutch swing-off victory. His three consecutive home runs in the tiebreaker propelled the National League to a 7-6 win over the American League. This win marks the first time a Phillies player has won the All-Star Game MVP since 1964.

title: Don Cherry comments on immigrants; Ron MacLean calls it an orchestrated exit strategy
content: Don Cherry was fired from Hockey Night in Canada in 2019 for controversial comments about immigrants and Remembrance Day poppies. Ron MacLean, his former co-host, suggested Cherry's remarks were a deliberate exit strategy following a pneumonia scare. Cherry denies MacLean's claims, expressing disappointment and stating he has no desire to discuss the matter further with MacLean.

title: Epstein hoax: Trump slams 'past supporters' who want client list to be released
content: Donald Trump has dismissed the ongoing Jeffrey Epstein controversy as a 'hoax' fabricated by Democrats, criticizing his former supporters for focusing on it. In a Truth Social post, Trump said he does not need his past supporters whom he called 'weaklings' as they have failed for the Epstein hoax and are not speaking about Trump's achievements of the last 6 months.

title: Warne or Murali ?: Who does Brian Lara admire more? WI legend breaks it down
content: Brian Lara, the West Indies legend, has sparked debate by declaring Shane Warne as a superior spinner to Muttiah Muralitharan, despite acknowledging Murali's ability to exert more pressure on batsmen. Lara highlighted Warne's mental strength and capacity to produce magical deliveries, while recognizing Muralitharan's impressive career statistics, including his record-breaking 800 Test wickets.

title: 'Will form government on our own': EPS rules out coalition govt with BJP
content: AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami asserted that his party will secure a solo victory in the 2026 assembly election, dismissing any possibility of a coalition government. He criticized the DMK alliance, suggesting internal conflicts, and accused Chief Minister M.K. Stalin of misusing the 'Ungaludan Stalin' program to gather voter data for political gain.

title: Terrorist killed in Udhampur was top JeM commander, J&K Police reveals
content: J&K DGP Nalin Prabhat announced the elimination of a Pakistani JeM commander in Udhampur's Dudu-Basantgarh forest, highlighting the crucial role of public support in anti-terror operations. The commander had been active in the region for four years.

title: NHL trade buzz: McDavid weighs Oilers loyalty; eyes free agency freedom
content: Elliotte Friedman suggests Connor McDavid is likely to sign a contract extension with the Edmonton Oilers, securing his future with the team beyond the 2025-26 season. Despite recent playoff heartbreaks and speculation about McDavid exploring free agency, the Oilers' captain seems committed to chasing a Stanley Cup in Edmonton. Negotiations for a lucrative contract extension are expected.

title: Vegas Freestyle | 'I’m 22 years old' – Niemann takes a jibe at Carlsen
content: Ahead of the Las Vegas leg of the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam Tour, Hans Niemann asserts that Magnus Carlsen and other top players face greater pressure due to past events. Niemann highlights his recent online successes against Carlsen and Hikaru Nakamura, suggesting they are more stressed when facing him.

title: 'Detain me, if you can': Mamata dares BJP; accuses of 'targeting' Bengali migrants
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee launched a scathing attack on the BJP, accusing them of targeting Bengali speakers in BJP-ruled states and manipulating voter lists. She refuted allegations linking Bengali migrants to illegal immigration, challenging the BJP to prove their claims. Banerjee vowed to defend Bengali identity and resist any attempts to remove names from electoral rolls, threatening political retaliation.

title: Epstein Files: What is the Mossad agent conspiracy theory
content: Tucker Carlson's claims that Jeffrey Epstein was a Mossad agent have reignited a controversial conspiracy theory, prompting strong denials from former Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett. The theory, fueled by Epstein's wealth and ties to Israeli leaders, is seen by some as a demand for accountability, while others warn against antisemitic tropes and baseless accusations.

title: 'Akbar brutal, Babur ruthless': NCERT gives Mughal era a makeover; adds a no-blame footnote
content: NCERT’s new Class 8 Social Science textbook reframes medieval Indian history, including the Mughal era, with a balanced, critical lens. While detailing events like Babur’s invasions and Akbar’s conquests, it avoids assigning blame, urging students to analyse rather than judge. The textbook promotes understanding complex pasts to foster empathy, reflection, and informed citizenship in today’s learners.

title: Mark Zuckerberg on techies joining Meta for big salaries: LoL, that’s mostly ...
content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg refutes claims that hefty paychecks are the primary draw for AI researchers joining Meta. He asserts that access to unparalleled compute power and the opportunity to develop 'superintelligence' are the key motivators. Zuckerberg highlights Meta's offering of 'infinite GPUs,' small, impactful teams, and freedom to experiment, attracting top talent from rivals like OpenAI and Google DeepMind.

title: IND vs ENG: Chucking or correct action?: Bumrah's untold story revealed
content: Jasprit Bumrah, the world's leading Test bowler, maintains his dominance with a significant lead in the rankings. His unique action, initially questioned by others, was identified by his childhood coach as a natural weapon. The coach advised him to retain his original style, which proved crucial in shaping Bumrah's successful career.

title: The four fruits that cut cholestrol (and make the heart stronger)
content: The nutritional content of fruits includes fiber, together with vitamins and antioxidants, which work to support cardiovascular well-being. The soluble fiber content in fruits, serves as the primary factor that helps reduce cholesterol levels. Soluble fiber within the digestive system binds to the cholestrol, and helps get rid of it from the body. Here are 4 such fruits

title: 'No anti-national statements': Rijiju's advice to Rahul over foreign policy remarks
content: Kiren Rijiju responded to Rahul Gandhi's criticism of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's foreign policy. Rijiju accused Gandhi of speaking against the nation and using the language of Pakistan. He defended the Prime Minister's foreign policy decisions. Rijiju also mentioned upcoming Parliament session. He said that the government is open to discussion.

title: LeBron & Savannah bump into Pelinka — unexpected meet sparks peace talk
content: Amidst swirling rumors of tension, LeBron James and Lakers' GM Rob Pelinka were seen exchanging greetings at a Summer League game, where James supported his son, Bronny. Despite the positive interaction, speculation persists regarding James' player option and potential contract extension. His manager, Rich Paul, addressed the rumors, emphasizing James' focus on enjoying his offseason.

title: Nimisha death sentence case: 'Insist on implementing God's law' - what Yemen family said
content: The family of Talal Abdo Mahdi seeks justice in the Nimisha Priya case. They demand 'Qisas' under God's Law. Yemen postponed Priya's execution. Hope rests on indemnity settlement with the deceased's family. Priya was convicted in 2020 for Mahdi's murder. She is imprisoned in Sana'a. Paying 'blood money' is the only option to save Priya.

title: AI wars: Nvidia CEO Huang calls Chinese AI models “world class”; one ‘banned’ by the US government
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang praised Chinese AI models as "world class" at a Beijing expo, highlighting their open-source approach and global impact. This endorsement comes as Nvidia resumes H20 chip sales to China, signaling an easing of trade tensions.

title: 'Udaipur files': Supreme Court defers hearing to July 21
content: The Supreme Court has instructed the Centre committee to promptly decide on the release and certification of 'Udaipur Files,' acknowledging the filmmakers' urgency. This decision follows concerns raised about the film's potential impact on a fair trial and its portrayal of a specific community.

title: Pant's run out, lone century, Stokes' victim: KL Rahul breaks silence on Lord's heartbreak
content: Following India's 22-run defeat to England in the Lord's Test, KL Rahul reflected on the loss, emphasizing the valuable lessons learned. Ravi Shastri highlighted Rishabh Pant's run-out and Karun Nair's dismissal as pivotal moments that shifted the game's momentum.

title: Top 5 entertainment news: Salman Khan sells Bandra West apartment for Rs 5.35 Crore, Jackson Wang REACTS to dating rumours with Disha Patani
content: Tinseltown is buzzing with news! Salman Khan reportedly sold his Bandra West apartment for ₹5.35 Crore. Meanwhile, Jackson Wang addressed dating rumors involving Disha Patani. Vicky Kaushal's birthday post featured a sweet kiss for Katrina Kaif. In other news, Malhotra and Kiara Advani have officially announced the arrival of their daughter, Raina.

title: Share of clean energy in India’s electricity less than 30% despite 50% of installed capacity
content: Despite the rise in clean energy, the slower rise utilisation is due to its lower ‘capacity utilisation factor’; flexibility in the grid and improved battery storage are the way forward, says expert

title: Flash floods: eight families relocated at Maruthonkara in Kozhikode
content: Recue squads on alert in landslip-prone areas on the orders of the District Disaster Management Authority

title: AI will boost decision-making and operational precision, says Lt. General Manjinder Singh
content: The General Officer Commanding-in-Chief, South Western Command stressed the importance of developing sophisticated capabilities to counter hybrid threats that blur the lines between peace and war

title: CPI (Maoist) acknowledge losing 357 cadres in encounters with security forces, says Bastar IG
content: Mr. Sundarraj said the admission highlighted the severe setbacks suffered by the banned outfit, especially in core conflict zones

title: Ties in region back in focus with PM’s forthcoming visit to Maldives
content: Modi to attend Independence Day celebrations in Male on July 26; plans are also under way for a proposed visit to Delhi by Nepal PM Oli, which will be the first since he was took charge in 2024

title: 34 of 100 large glacial lakes show an ‘increasing trend’ in water spread area, Central Water Commission tells NGT
content: The National Green Tribunal is looking into the issue of melting glaciers resulting in an increase in the size of glacier lakes, and the danger of their overflowing and bursting, with consequential effects

title: Parliamentary panel clears Income Tax Bill 2025 with 285 suggestions, to be tabled in Monsoon Session
content: Introduced in Lok Sabha on February 13, 2025, the Bill was referred to a Select Committee on the same day with instructions to report by the first day of Monsoon Session

title: PM Modi to unveil projects worth over ₹7,000 crore in Bihar on July 18
content: The Prime Minister should speak about basic issues like unemployment, and migration, confronting the state. Of late the law-and-order situation in the State has become alarming, and the PM must say something on this as well

title: Parliament canteen rolls out curated ‘health menu’
content: The wellness initiative has been taken up by Lok Sabha Speak Om Birla; the dishes on offer are millet-based meals, fibre-rich salads and protein-packed soups as part of a broader effort to support a healthy diet

title: Himachal Pradesh to get additional ₹150 crore revenue after royalty hike in hydroelectric project
content: A State government statement said the JSW energy company will have to pay 18% royalty to the State instead of 12% from the Karcham-Wangtoo hydroelectric project

title: NMC rejects Karnataka’s proposal to start three new medical colleges, enhancement of government college medical seats
content: NMC cites a lack of necessary infrastructure and faculty recruitment as it denies permission for two govt. medical colleges for the third time

title: Renewed optimism in Canada-India economic ties, says business council leader
content: India presents enormous potential for Canadian firms looking to diversify beyond the U.S. market, says Victor T. Thomas, president and CEO of the Canada-India Business Council

title: Social activist alleges negligence in Rahul Gandhi’s security during U.P. court visit, seeks probe
content: Amitabh Thakur, a former IPS officer and social activist, alleges that security personnel allowed hundreds of people into a Lucknow courtroom during a Congress leader’s appearance

title: BBMP to float tender for stray dog microchipping project, for third time
content: Project is estimated to cost ₹3.23 crore of which ₹3.09 crore is allocated for procuring 1,62,817 microchips and ₹14.85 lakh is set aside for purchasing 50 microchip readers

title: Veteran Congress leader C.V. Padmarajan passes away
content: He had handled Finance, Power, and Fisheries in the K. Karunakaran and A.K. Antony governments. He was twice elected to the Assembly from the Chathanoor constituency in Kollam district. He also served as the president of the Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee from 1983 to 1987

title: Government merges 36 schemes to float farm programme
content: The PM Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana, announced in the Budget earlier this year, aims at increasing agricultural productivity and sustainable practices with an annual outlay of ₹24,000 crore for six years

title: HC terms ADGP’s travel in tractor to Sabarimala Sannidhanam as unfortunate
content: R. Jayakrishnan, Sabarimala Special Commissioner, had informed the court that the officer had  violated the court directive not to allow persons to use tractors meant for transportation of goods to the Sannidhanam

title: Hyderabad-based gem merchant held for stealing from foreigners in Bengaluru star hotels
content: Srinivasulu would gather details about conferences held in star hotels from the media and attend them, posing as a delegate

title: Another Key Ally Is Quitting Netanyahu's Coalition, Dealing A Major Blow
content: Israeli Prime Minister suffered a major political blow on Wednesday, with a key governing partner announcing it was, leaving him with a minority in parliament as the country faces a litany of challenges.

title: Delhi To Step-Up Measures To Tackle Dengue, Start Fogging Early
content: With the monsoon bringing heightened risk of mosquito-borne diseases, Chief Minister Rekha Gupta on Wednesday instructed Delhi government departments to step up preventative action against dengue, including advancing fogging operations and holding of

title: 'Holding Them Felt Like Home': Shubhanshu Shukla Meets Family After 18 Days In Space
content: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla reunited with his wife, Kamna Shukla and six-year-old son Kiash Shukla after his 18-day mission aboard the International Space Station (ISS).

title: 9-Year-Old Faints In Rajasthan School, Dies; Doctors Suspect Heart Attack
content: Prachi Kumawat was just nine years old, studying in Class 4 in Sikar's Danta town. But in a bizarre turn of events, the seemingly healthy girl sat down for lunch during break time on Tuesday morning, only to open her tiffin and fall unconscious.

title: Delhi High Court Fines Woman For "Casually" Filing Sex Offence Case Against Partner
content: The Delhi High Court has fined a woman with Rs 20,000 for "casually" filing a case of sexual offence against her live-in partner.

title: Amid Row Over Contentious Project, Andhra, Telangana Discuss Water Sharing
content: Amid a backdrop of heightened political sensitivities in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, the Chief Ministers Chandrababu Naidu and Revanth Reddy held a surprisingly cordial and productive meeting in New Delhi on Wednesday.

title: "Heinous Crime": Visually Impaired Minor Girl Raped In Haryana, Say Cops
content: A mentally challenged and visually impaired girl was allegedly raped in Karnal, police said on Wednesday.

title: Popular Meghalaya Bakery Shut Down Over Use of Newspapers To Bake Bread
content: The Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) have shut down the popular bakery RB Store here for allegedly using newspapers to bake bread and cakes, in violation of norms, officials said here on Wednesday.

title: 'Can't Be Global Power With Stray Dog Problem At Home': Karti Chidambaram
content: No developed country is struggling with any street dog or stray cattle problem, and India can't aspire to be a global power when the huge health and safety issue remains unsolved, Congress MP Karti Chidambaram told NDTV on Wednesday.

title: 35 Lakh Bihar Voters' Names On Exclusion List, Poll Body To Share Data
content: As the July 25 deadline draws close for submission of enumeration forms under the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in Bihar, the Election Commission of India has revealed that around 35.6 lakh voters may face exclusion.

title: "Going To Have Access To India": Trump's Big Hint On Trade Deal
content: President Donald Trump has indicated that the ongoing negotiations between India and the US for a much-anticipated interim trade deal are on track and it could be sealed soon.

title: How Can India Resolve Its Stray Dog Crisis? Lessons From Netherlands
content: A video of a street dog blocking the path of a Lamborghini Huracan supercar on a Mumbai street is going viral on social media, amusing many people who have dubbed the canine "Dogesh" and calling him the "real boss of the roads."

title: Iran's Khamenei Calls Israel "Dog On A Leash" Of US, Warns Of "Bigger Blows"
content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said on Wednesday that it is ready to respond to any renewed military attack, and that it could deliver an even bigger blow to its adversaries, than what it gave during the 12-day war with Israel.

title: "Not Guilty": Supreme Court Acquits Man On Death Row After 11 Years In Jail
content: The Supreme Court in an important judgment today set aside the death sentence of Baljinder Kumar from Kapurthala, who has been in jail for over 11 years in murder cases of his wife, two toddlers and sister-in-law.

title: Fauja Singh's Last Wish Was To Spend Rest Of His Life In Britain
content: World's oldest marathon runner Fauja Singh wanted to spend the rest of his life in Britain. His last wish could not be fulfilled.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Barak Valley In Crisis - Call for Connectivity, Equity, And National Integration
content: Decades of infrastructural neglect and recurring monsoon disasters demand a transformative development package for Assam's Barak Valley.

title: Asim Munir Can Replace Asif Ali Zardari As Next Pakistan President: Report
content: The latest meeting of Pakistan's top civilian and military leadership has once again fuelled rumours of a possible change in the country's political landscape amid speculations of the army chief possibly aspiring to be the next president.

title: Microsoft, US National Lab To Use AI To Speed Up Nuclear Plant Licensing
content: Microsoft and a US national laboratory on Wednesday said they are partnering to examine how artificial intelligence could be used to speed up the process of compiling the documents needed to secure permits for new nuclear power plants.

title: Barclays Fined $56 Million Over Poor Handling Of Crime Risks
content: Britain's financial watchdog on Wednesday said it had fined Barclays bank $56 million for "poor handling of financial crime risks".

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu urges Centre to provide ₹10,000 crore under SASCI, revenue deficit compensation
content: The State still grapples with limited financial resources, which is affecting its developmental aspirations, the Chief Minister tells Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman

title: Bhoothathankettu hydro project: KSEB plans to send technical team to China to inspect delayed batch of equipment
content: Reconsidering an earlier decision to terminate a contract for electromechanical works of the small hydro project will depend on the team’s report

title: Ex-husband seeks shared custody after Russian woman, kids found living in Karnataka’s Gokarna cave
content: Dror Goldstein said he had been living separately from Kutina for the last couple of years and that he "lost touch" with them when she took the daughters and left Goa a few months ago

title: Expert suggests removal of Vedan’s song from Calicut varsity syllabus
content: A Syndicate member affiliated to the BJP had earlier complained to the V-C and the Chancellor that the inclusion of the song in the syllabus was inappropriate

title: Friends of Snakes Society completes 30 years rescuing reptiles in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh
content: The society would launch a website with information on hospitals which provide treatment for snakebites

title: Karnataka comes up with draft rules for digital e-stamping
content: Once implemented, the Karnataka Stamps (Digital e-stamp) Rules, 2025, will replace traditional stamp papers with entirely digital stamping, aligning with sustainability goals and paving the way for paperless stamping

title: Aggregator begins charging revised auto fares ahead of August 1 implementation, draws flak from commuters
content: The fare hike, announced by the Bengaluru Urban Regional Transport Authority (RTA) on July 14, is scheduled to come into effect from August 1

title: RTC workers announce indefinite strike from August 5 over pending demands
content: In a letter to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, the unions criticised the government for ignoring transport workers’ grievances, including the release of pending arrears, pay revision, and timely promotions.

title: Golden visa schemes are response to conflicts, Trump’s decisions on U.S. citizenship: Dubai-based immigration expert
content: Mr. Boiko said changing rules and taxation are pushing more and more high achievers to find safe locations where they can ensure safety of their finances and conduct business without hindrance

title: Century-old building of Travancore kingdom collapses
content: The single room building was used to store explosives for construction of temples and the Kottayam-Kumily road.

title: Open access fuel farm commissioned at Thiruvananthapuram airport
content: An open access fuel farm is a common fuel storage and supply system that allows multiple oil marketing companies to provide aviation fuel through a shared infrastructure

title: Kerala University Registrar “defies” V-C’s direction on use of official vehicle
content: V-C chairs an online meeting of Centre for Global Academics and it decides to grant admission to 93 foreign students across various affiliated colleges

title: One more suspected Nipah case reported in Palakkad
content: n the latest case, the son of a 58-year-old man from Kumaramputhur who succumbed to the deadly virus at Moulana Hospital, Perinthalmanna, on Saturday last, was found Nipah positive in the initial test done at Government Medical College Hospital laboratory at Manjeri.

title: HRF opposes land acquisition for Indosol project at Karedu
content: Members of Rashtra Cheneta Jana Samakhya also participate in a campaign against the land acquisition of more than 8,500 acres in various villages for the proposed solar project

title: Trump hints at trade deal with India soon; says U.S. will have access to Indian market
content: U.S. President Trump said the proposed deal could provide American companies greater access to the Indian market in line with the trade pact between the U.S. and Indonesia

title: Aanayootu and Gajapooja at Vadakkumnathan temple
content: To ensure a smooth flow and crowd management, authorities have erected a temporary flyover near the western entrance of the temple

title: Traffic disrupted for over two hours as tree falls on National Highway in Idukki
content: In June, a team comprising the Valara Forest Range Officer and NHAI officials had identified 682 trees and two bamboo groves on the 14.5-km Neriamangalam-Valara-Adimaly stretch that pose threat to passengers. However, following an HC order, tree felling on the stretch has been stopped

title: TDP leaders and police officials will face the consequences if YSRPC comes to power, warns Jagan Mohan Reddy
content: Accusing Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu of misusing power to harass leaders and cadres of the opposition party, he alleges that Certain DIGs and police officers are behaving like mafia dons, collecting bribes from illegal liquor and sand operations, and sharing the proceeds with ruling party leaders

title: Martyrs’ Day in Kashmir: A look at its history and the BJP’s indifference
content: Twenty two Muslim civilians were slain by the Dogra police in July 1931 as they opposed the Maharaja’s diktat

title: Ensure quality education and training, Minister tells HIMS authorities
content: Sharanprakash Patil takes exception to the slow pace of renovation work on the ground and first floors of the District Hospital in Haveri

title: Sidhu Moosewala to perform again as hologram in global tour set to launch in 2026
content: The tour will kick off in 2026 with shows lined up in Punjab as well as global cities like Toronto, London and Los Angeles. It will be a first-of-its kind hologram event that will help fans virtually meet the late musician

title: Come Karkidakam, pilgrims cover four temples in a day in search of solace
content: Thousands of pilgrims visit the temples of Rama, Bharata, Lakshmana, and Shatrughna, seeking blessings

title: Bharath wants ‘new look’ Kurnool city
content: Industries and Commerce Minister suggests officials to develop Kurnool city along the lines of Visakhapatnam

title: Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka vie over aerospace park after the latter calls off land acquisition in Devanahalli
content: Following Andhra Pradesh Minister Nara Lokesh’s offer, Karnataka Industries Minister M.B. Patil categorically said the cancellation of the land acquisition, after protests by farmer groups, did not mean the end of the aerospace project

title: CREEA report charts plans to protect crops, livelihoods, food security in Kerala
content: CREEA is a blueprint for an inclusive, low-carbon farm economy that keeps smallholders at the centre of climate action, says Agriculture Minister P. Prasad

title: Agent: Beal OKs buyout with Suns, to join Clips
content: Bradley Beal has agreed to a buyout with the Suns and plans to join the Clippers on a two-year, $11M deal with an option after he clears waivers, his agent told ESPN.

title: Sources: Oakmont bars Clark over locker damage

content: President Donald Trump is not getting an Open Championship to the Turnberry course he owns in the near future, which the R&A's new chief executive said was more about transportation than politics.

title: Fever's Clark questionable with right groin injury
content: Caitlin Clark, who recently came back from a left groin injury, is now listed as questionable for the Fever's game Wednesday against the Liberty after sustaining a right groin injury.

title: FIFA reveals details to apply for World Cup tickets
content:
Applications for tickets for the 2026 World Cup open Sept. 10, FIFA said Tuesday. The next edition of the tournament, which will be co-hosted by Canada, Mexico and the United States, kicks off at the Azteca Stadium in Mexico City on June 11. Soccer's world governing body FIFA said that due to anticipated high demand tickets would be released in phases. -  World Cup lessons from Club World Cup 
-  Club World Cup takeaways 
-  Infantino: Covered stadiums to be used at '26 WC It did not say if it would use dynamic pricing, as was the case for the Club World Cup, which saw ticket prices fluctuate wildly. "We're looking forward to welcoming the world back to North America, as Canada, Mexico and the United States host what will be the biggest and greatest sporting event ever," FIFA president Gianni Infantino said in a statement. "We encourage fans everywhere to get ready to secure their place -- these will be the most coveted seats in world sport."

title: Check out all the 2025 ESPYS candidates and vote now
